revised_title: Electrical Properties and Composition of Lecithin-In-Hydrocarbon Films
tldr: The authors investigated the electrical properties and composition of lecithin-in-hydrocarbon films in aqueous solutions. They found that the films had a dielectric dispersion with one relaxation time and that only the hydrocarbon part contributed to the capacitance. The thickness of the films was deduced from the parallel plate capacitor formula, and the results were compared with the literature values for cell membranes.
